experience: You and Clifford both know Sergey Zaytsev, Colleen Perrone, and 64 others
I could have LOST my wife and my oldest daughter last night.
By the grace of God, they survived this horrific accident on the 91 freeway.

They are hurt pretty badly, but will get through it. They were coming home on the 91 East in the fast track and someone ran over the pylon to cut into the fast track lanes, and going very slow when they cut over right in front of my wife.
Such a dangerous and unnecessary risk.
I’m grateful to the Corona Firefighters, many of whom are personal friends, who immediately recognized my wife and daughter and took great care of them.
The 91 freeway shut down for a very long time.

The police estimated that my wife and daughter spun about 200 feet from the impact and were hit by at least 5 different cars. All because someone wanted to cut over and sneak in the fast track. I'm also very grateful for TESLA building such a safe and strong car.

Life is fragile. God is good. Love my wife and daughter and I’m glad that are only injured and will be okay. Daughter has broken collar bone and my wife injured her foot. We also pray for others who were hurt in this accident.
Though they are injured and shaken up, it could’ve been much much worse.
Squeeze your loved ones tight today.
RESA Wearables Debuts its Custom Insoles at Costco and Commissions CTS/Mighty Touch to Produce Kiosks

Created, branded, and marketed MobileHID as a source for the best value on industrial-grade lighting products for the construction, agriculture, logging, and excavation industries.+ Created and increased brand recognition through viral marketing and strategic online marketing through social media and online community relations.+ Continually analyze web traffic to adjust site content based on visitor interest and browsing behavior and improve SEO.+ Strategically generated web traffic by establishing an effective web presence resulting in “top 10” search engine rankings with Google and Yahoo.+ Coordinate importation and fulfillment of orders to and from a warehouse in Arizona to ensure products are in stock for customers.+ Forecast inventory based on buying behavior and industry needs.

ClearBraFilms.com serves as a nationwide directory for the paint protection service industry.  It directly connects customers and service providers to save consumers money and generate retail revenue for the service providers. It ranks on page 1 of Google / Bing / Yahoo for the intuitive keywords "clear bra" and other location oriented searches. * Envisioned then created an online directory to organize and scale offline agreements between brick and mortar lead generators and service providers.* Researched and gathered data on over 800 service providers to build database.* Successfully marketed and organically search engine optimized the directory service to the top of the search engines.

In short, I made magic happen.Coplex helps subject matter experts build software businesses so they can take advantage of opportunities they've recognized in their respective industries.  I like to practice "Immersive Product Management" where I put myself in the end users' shoes to understand the problems first hand.  By doing so, I've helped our ventures create better products and have done things I normally wouldn't have ever done like attend AA meetings, drive for Uber and Lyft, smoke vaporizers, etc... Things I did almost every day: + Host workshops to help ventures ideate and plan their product direction.+ Discover new 3rd party tools to help our ventures build their startups.+ Guide the product shaping process and SCRUM development efforts on time and within budget.+ Maintain a Build Measure Learn loop by creating test cards and tests to validate assumptions in the lean product development process.+ Create User Stories in the Icebox and test completed tasks before delivering to the Product Owner in Pivotal Tracker.+ Review UI/UX best practices to help the team gain context for a specific industry.+ Understand and evaluate goals to set the technical direction for development.+ Send weekly progress/budget reports on product development with sprint burndown charts and completed tasks in and out of sprint.
Overall Problem Solver and Manager, Site-Building Software Development

* Spearheaded the Executive Accounts department to handle GoDaddy’s biggest customers and data mined purchase behavior to discover new revenue opportunities making it the most profitable customer service sales team.* Restructured and trained GoDaddy's Billing Department to convert customers demanding refunds into customers spending more on the right products that fit their needs.  After years of operating as a cost center, the department now competes with the Executive Accounts department as the highest revenue generating business unit.* Continuously monitored consumer behavior on three site building applications and identified opportunities to increase user engagement and feature adoption across several hundred thousand customers that brought in $20M+ in annual revenue* Improved and drove product innovation, leveraging consumer insights collected via customer service staff, feedback submissions, usability testing, and a product Blog.* Managed product road map and planned small but frequent product enhancements in an agile development environment to ensure product stability and an incremental learning curve for customers.

The phrase "it takes a village to raise a child" is true.  One of the biggest responsibilities that we have as custodians of today is to help children be responsible contributors tomorrow.  Working with underprivileged youth not only helped me see the wider spectrum of life but also allowed me to help broaden their horizons.  Often times parents are too busy to raise children properly or don't have the desire or ability to give their children insight on how they can work harder/smarter to get themselves out of their current situation.  Unfortunately, sometimes the parents aren't even around.  One time I took my youth to lunch at PF Changs and he looked up in confusion and asked "Clifford, where are the pictures?".  That question spoke volumes in what kind of environment he lived in and inspired me to data dump as much useful career/life advice that I could to him so he could help himself in the future.  I'm so proud of him today.  He's a football coach at a school and does pre-paid legal sales on the side.  I know selling pre-paid legal in a multi-level marketing scheme isn't ideal but I'm just glad he's not selling cocaine or getting shot at nowadays.

Manager at The Farm House
November 18, 2013, Clifford worked with Ivy but at different companies

Four words:  IVY GETS THINGS DONE.I first met Ivy in 2011 when she was helping Hong Kong host a TEDx event.  Over the past couple of years, I've seen Ivy consistently, diligently, and professionally help the Hong Kong start-up community by running the entire operations for the SCC (Small to Medium Enterprise Creative Center) by herself.  She routinely plans, organizes, and facilitates events for SCC and collaborates with others to help Hong Kong host TEDx events.  All this while she's getting her master's degree at PolyU!If I needed an overall Manager or Operations person on my team, I'd hire her in a second.Thanks for all your hard work for the Hong Kong startup community.  We need more people like you.Clifford

summary: I enjoy fixing problems and implementing processes to ensure long term sustainability.10+ years running an eCommerce lighting business with customers around the world and creating a lead generation service for 300+ business across the country in the automotive industry.  The lighting business is in autopilot mode with customer service handled on the East Coast and order fulfillment done by a West Coast company while the lead generation service runs automatically.5+ years at GoDaddy.com building revenue by starting their Retention team, turning their Billing department into a profit center, training sales teams, and managing software development road maps for products in an agile environment with frequent releases to fit the needs of internal and external customers.Specialties: Inspiring teams to accomplish great things, eCommerce implementation, organic SEO, guerrilla marketing and branding, overseas sourcing, end-to-end CEM, and product management.
